sen.e: Sadamune OTOMO (year of birth unknown - January 9, 1334) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the late Kamakura Period.

sen.j: 元弘3年/正慶2年(1333年)3月、後醍醐天皇の密命を受けて攻めてきた菊池武時を英時や少弐貞経らと共に敗死させた。
sen.e: In April 1333, he was attacked by Taketoki KIKUCHI receiving a secret order from the Emperor Godaigo and he with Hidetoki, Sadatsune SHONI and others put him to rout and death.

sen.j: しかし、同年5月に足利尊氏らによって京都の六波羅探題が攻略され、討幕軍優勢が九州にまで伝わると、貞宗は貞経や島津氏らと共に英時から離反してこれを攻め殺した。
sen.e: However, in June of the same year, Rokuhara Tandai (an administrative and judicial agency in Rokuhara, Kyoto) in Kyoto was captured by Takauji ASHIKAGA and others and the news of the dominance of anti-Shogunate army spread through Kyushu, then Sadamune with Sadatsune, the Shimazu clan and others broke away from Hidetoki and attacked and killed him.

sen.j: その功績により豊後国の守護職を与えられたが、同年12月3日に京都で急死した。
sen.e: He was given Shugoshiki (post of provincial constable) of Bungo Province for this achievement, but on December 3 of the same year (January 9, 1334 in new calendar) he died suddenly in Kyoto.
